question: Which is the headquarters of the UNâ€™s Economic Commission for Europe (UNECE)?
explanation:
The United Nations Economic Commission for Europe (UNECE) was set up in 1947 by the United Nations Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC).
It is headquartered at Geneva, Switzerland. As per the recent report published by the UNECE, trapping and storing carbon dioxide emissions from fossil power generation and industry is needed = to achieve carbon neutrality.
